facts.1: Marks the date when humanity's demand for ecological resources exceeds Earth's annual regeneration.
facts.2: Hosted and calculated by the Global Footprint Network.
facts.3: Concept was first conceived by Andrew Simms of the UK think tank New Economics Foundation.

facts.1: Commemorates the founding of the Republic of Macedonia within the Yugoslav Federation in 1944.
facts.2: Also known as Ilinden, the day of the Ilinden Uprising against the Ottoman Empire in 1903.
facts.3: A public holiday in North Macedonia with official ceremonies and cultural events.

facts.1: Celebrates the ice cream sandwich, a dessert of ice cream between cookies or pastry.
facts.2: Observed annually on August 2nd in the United States.
facts.3: Modern concept invented in 1945 by Jerry Newberg at Forbes Field in Pittsburgh.
